sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The predestinated thief A dialogue betwixt a rigid Calvinian preacher and a condemned malefactor. In which is not onely represented how the Calvinistical opinion occasions the perpetration of wickedness and impieties; but moreover how it doth impede and hinder, nay almost impossibilitate the reducing of a sinner to emendation and repentance. Slatius, Henry, 1585-1623.
[12], 65, [1] p.
printed by R. Trott for Daniel Jones, and are to be sold at the three Hearts in S. Paul's Church-yard, London : 1658.
By Henricus Slatius. Includes index. Caption title on p. 1 reads: A dialogue had betwixt a Calvinist preacher and a condemned malefactor. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Slatius, Henry, 1585-1623.
[12], 65, [1] p.
printed by R. Trott for Daniel Jones, and are to be sold at the three Hearts in S. Paul's Church-yard, London : 1658.
